item.title: Obversation about Homotopy Category
item.description: Let $\mathcal{A}$ be an exact category such that for any two objects $A$ and $A’$ in $\mathcal{A}$, we have a predefined structure of abelian groups in each $\mathrm{Hom}\mathcal{A}(A,A’)$. And let $\mathrm{Kom}(\mathcal{A})$ be the category of chain complexes with values in $\mathcal{A}$. The classical definition of homtopy category is stated by setting an equivalence relation $\sim$ in each $\mathrm{Hom}{\mathrm{Kom}(\mathcal{A})}(A^\bullet,B^\bullet)$, i.e.: for any $f,g\in \mathrm{Hom}{\mathrm{Kom}(\mathcal{A})}(A^\bullet,B^\bullet)$, $f\sim g$ if and only if there exists a family of morphisms $s^i\in\mathrm{Hom}\mathcal{A}(A^i,B^{i-1})$ in such that $f^i-g^i=s^{i+1}\circ d_{A^\bullet}+d_{B^\bullet}^{i-1}\circ s^i$ in $\mathcal{A}$.
